content: the pure shores pullover is a simple and stylish sweater with beautiful cabled details it is knitted seamlessly top down with a turtle neck and a classic drop shoulder construction the piece is started at the back then stitches are picked up along the shoulders for the fronts once the back and front is knitted the sweater joins in the round for the body lastly the turtle neck is worked in the round from the neck edge and stitches are picked up for the sleeves knit a swatch to determine which needle size you need to achieve the correct gauge note that this can vary from yarn to yarn take care to wash the swatch before measuring size guide xxs xs s m l xl 2xl 3xl bust circumference 75-80 81-85 86-90 91-95 96-100 101-110 111-120 121-130 the pullover is designed to have approx 15 - 18 cm of positive ease meaning the sizes above are designed to achieve a finished garment of 95 100 105 110 115 125 135 145 cm measure yourself with a measuring tape around your bust or your widest upper body part to determine which size will fit you the best for example if you measure 88 cm around the widest part on your upper body you should knit a size s a size s sweater has a bust circumference of 104 cm = 15 cm positive ease sleeve circumference 38 40 42 44 46 48 50 52 cm length armhole 19 20 21 22 23 24 25 26 cm length mid back 52 54 55 56 58 60 62 cm yarn suggestions the pattern is written for using a worsted weight yarn 550 550-600 600-650 700 750 800 850 900 meters merino by svarta fåret 100m/50g sample is shown in colorway cannoli cream and pure shores gauge 21 sts x 31 row in stockinette stitch on 4 0mm us 6 needles after blocking = 10x10 cm 4x4 inches gauge sleeves 17 sts x 27 row in stockinette stitch on 4 0mm us 6 needles after blocking = 10x10 cm 4x4 inches gauge cables 23 sts in p2 3/3 lc or rc p2 = 10 cm on 4 0mm us 6 needles after blocking gauge cables 2 p2 4/4 rc p1 4/4 lc p2 14 sts = 9 5 cm on 4 0mm us 6 needles after blocking
